PopularDestination.title: Popular Destination
PopularDestination.subTitle: Tours give you the opportunity to explore

travelPlaces.title: Hokkaido, Japan
travelPlaces.info: Hokkaido is the second largest island of Japan and is located in the northernmost part of the country. It is also the largest and northernmost prefecture of Japan, making up its own region. The island is separated from Honshu, the main island of Japan, by the Tsugaru Strait and is connected to it by the undersea railway Seikan Tunnel. It is a place to visit year round because of its cool summers and snowy winters offering ski resorts and hot springs. Sapporo, the capital of Hokkaido, hosts the annual Snow Festival in February. Other areas of interest include Niseko, Otaru and Hakodate.

travelPlaces.title: Venice Canals, Italy
travelPlaces.info: A gondola ride through the canals of Venice is a tradition that travelers have been participating in for centuries. Venice is a city of islands and the canals have long been, in many ways, the city's streets. Lining the canals are the old buildings which have remained relatively unchanged for hundreds of years, adding to the romantic charm. The Grand Canal is the most famous of these waterways and one of the most photographed sites in Venice.

Destination.title: Search Your Dream Destination
Destination.subTitle: Fill in the field below to find the best destination

places.desc: The Taj Mahal is one of the seven wonders of the world and is considered to be the most popular tourist attraction in India. A symbol of love, the Taj was built by Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan for his queen Mumtaz. Tagore described the Taj as a 'teardrop on the cheek of eternity'. The monument attracts a lot of tourists all around the year.

Tangibly the most spiritual place in India, Golden Temple, also known as Sri Harmindar Sahib, is the holiest shrine in Sikhism which is alive with religious fervour and sacredness. Although the Golden Temple itself is of great historical and architectural interest, it is the view of the resplendent shrine, glistening in the centre of the tank, bringing an infinite calmness that is most memorable to a visitor.

hotels.place: Hotel Grand Cabbana By LevelUp Hotels & Resorts

places.desc: The Red Fort is a historical tourist attraction in India in the national capital of New Delhi. Located in the center of the city, it was the main residence of the emperors of the Mughal dynasty. It was constructed by Shah Jahan in the year 1939 as a result of a capital shift from Agra to Delhi.

Mysore Palace An incredibly breathtaking example of Indo Saracenic style of architecture, the Mysore Palace is a magnificent edifice located in Mysore in the state of Karnataka. Also known as the Amba Vilas Palace, it is the former palace of the royal family of Mysore and is still their official residence.

Cradled on the top of the Aravali Hill and forming a beautiful reflection across the Maotha Lake, lies the Amber Fort. An architectural masterpiece and with significant reference in the Indian history, it is visited by over five thousand tourists daily. Only eleven kilometres away from the capital city of Jaipur, Amber Fort is clad in pink and yellow sandstone and is a part of an extensive complex.

hotels.place: Umaid Residency - A Regal Heritage Home

places.desc: Goa a tiny state on the western coast of India along the Arabian Sea, is famous for its laidback beaches, night long parties, beach shacks, water sports and many other adventure activities. One of the most visited tourist attractions in India, Goa has many beaches along its beautiful coastline, catering to millions of visitors every year.

hotels.place: Kyriad Prestige Calangute Goa by OTHPL
DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Goa - Arpora - Baga

places.desc: For travelers making their way through Italy, the Colosseum is a must see. This huge Amphitheater is the largest of its kind ever built by the Roman Empire and has remained a model for sports facilities right up to modern times.

A gondola ride through the canals of Venice is a tradition that travelers have been participating in for centuries. Venice is a city of islands and the canals have long been, in many ways, the city's streets. Lining the canals are the old buildings which have remained relatively unchanged for hundreds of years, adding to the romantic charm. The Grand Canal is the most famous of these waterways and one of the most photographed sites in Venice.

hotels.place: Rome Cavalieri, A Waldorf Astoria Hotel
Hotel Carlton On The Grand Canal

places.desc: Below the rumbling volcano of Mt Vesuvius stand the ruins of Pompeii, an ancient Roman city preserved in time by the eruption in A.D. 79. Excavations have revealed the remains of houses, markets, baths, temples, theaters, streets scarred by the tracks of chariots, and human remains. Visitors can tour the site, walk along the old streets, and see the engineering used by Romans over 2000 years ago.

hotels.place: Caruso, A Belmond Hotel, Amalfi Coast

places.desc: The Leaning Tower of Pisa is actually just one of many attractions in the city of Pisa, but its fame, gained from its flaw, is world renown. Work began on the tower in the 1100s and the sinking, which led to the lean, began by the time the tower reached the third story. Prior to restoration work in the 1990s, it was predicted to topple over by the year 2000. Today, visitors can climb up the stairs of the tower for a fabulous view over the city. The Leaning Tower, also known as La Torre Pendete, stands on the Piazza del Duomo.

Lake Como is one of Italy's most scenic areas, surrounded by mountains and lined by small picturesque towns. Traditionally a haunt of the wealthy, the lake has many old opulent villas and palaces. Around the lake are resort communities and an 1hth century abbey. The mild climate is also a draw for tourists, with characteristics similar to that of the Mediterranean.

In 2022, the famous amusement park welcomed more than 15 million visitors, making it the most visited attraction in France. According to the Atout France report, Disneyland Paris attracts as many French tourists as foreigners each year. Its iconic attractions, such as Space Mountain, the Magic Carpets or the Tower of Terror, along with the themed restaurants, grandiose hotels and souvenir shops delight young and old alike.

The Louvre Museum was the second most visited site in France with 7.8 million visitors. Unlike Disneyland Paris, the study revealed that 70% of the museum's visitors are foreigners, mainly European and American. With more than 400 exhibition halls, artwork and artifacts cover a geographical area ranging from Western Europe to East Asia and Greece. Housed in the former residence of the kings of France, the Louvre has some of the most beautiful paintings in the world, such as the Mona Lisa, The Coronation of Napoleon and The Raft of the Medusa.

hotels.place: Hôtel du Louvre, in The Unbound Collection by Hyatt

places.desc: In 2022, more than 7 million tourists walked the Hall of Mirrors, discovered the King's Apartment and visited the sublime gardens at the Palace of Versailles. This site, just twenty kilometres southwest of Paris, is classified as a World Heritage Site and testifies to the ambition of Louis XIV, nickplaced 'Louis the Great' or 'the Sun King.' This palace is still the symbol of the political, economic and cultural power of 17th century France.

The Eiffel Tower is inextricably linked to both France and the city of Paris, and attracted 5.9 million visitors in 2022. The 'Iron Lady' offers a unique view of the French capital standing at 324 metres tall. That 360° view allows you to admire the Pantheon, Montparnasse Tower, Montmartre, the Seine, and more.

hotels.place: Hôtel le Derby Alma by Inwood Hotels

places.desc: The National Museum of Modern Art welcomed 5.4 million French and foreign tourists in 2022. More than 100,000 works of art are spread across roughly 28,000 m2, attracting art enthusiasts every year. The Centre national d'art et de culture Georges Pompidou, or simply the Centre Pompidou, is constantly reinventing itself through retrospectives, such as the Germaine Richier exhibit, or by adding new forms of artistic creation, such as NFTs.

Tokyo, the capital, is by far one of the most popular travel destinations in Japan. There is so much to see and do, you could spend a week just exploring its city centers of Shinjuku, Shibuya, Ikebukuro, Ueno, and Ginza. Notable attractions include the electronics city of Akihabara, Tokyo Tower, Kaminarimon at Asakusa, and Tokyo Disneyland.

Osaka is the commercial center of Japan and famous for its unique culture and foods. Enjoy takoyaki (octopus balls) in the entertainment district of Dotonbori and stroll the shopping streets stretching from Namba to Shinsaibashi. Then head over to Osaka Castle Park for cherry blossom viewing in the spring or the tower to see views of Osaka.

Kyoto is a must for every visitor to Japan. The streets are lined with ancient temples and traditional architecture to enjoy in this cultural city. Points of interest include Kiyomizu-dera, Kinkaku-ji, Ginkaku-ji and the Gion entertainment district. Just 20 minutes south of Kyoto is Uji, famous for high-quality matcha green tea.

Nagoya is the fourth largest city and centrally located between Osaka and Tokyo. Attractions include the Toyota Commemorative Museum of Industry and Technology, Nagoya Castle, and the underground shopping walkways in Sakae.

Hokkaido, the northernmost island, is a place to visit year round because of its cool summers and snowy winters offering ski resorts and hot springs. Sapporo, the capital of Hokkaido, hosts the annual Snow Festival in February. Other areas of interest include Niseko, Otaru and Hakodate.

hotels.place: The Maples Niseko(ザ・メイプルズ・ニセコ)

places.desc: NEW YORK CITY An iconic global centre that has inspired the world with its brilliant architecture, movies, and art. Also known as the Big Apple, New York is well-known for its magnificent skyscrapers, Broadway shows and beautiful landmarks, making it the perfect destination for travellers from all over.

hotels.place: The New Yorker A Wyndham Hotel

places.desc: Las Vegas a place that brings neon signboards, iconic hotels and the legendary casinos to our minds. For the ultimate, no-limits entertainment trip, there is hardly any place in the world that comes close to Vegas.

hotels.place: Hard Rock Hotel & Casino Las Vegas

places.desc: Los Angeles is the hub of all activities on the famous West Coast of the United States. It is the second-largest city in the country, and one of the US's prime tourist cities. Home to the world-famous Hollywood entertainment industry, Los Angeles has become a huge tourist destination.

hotels.place: JW Marriott Los Angeles L.A. LIVE
Omni Los Angeles Hotel at California Plaza
Holiday Inn Express & Suites Hollywood Walk of Fame, an IHG Hotel

places.desc: San Francisco is one of the most important cities on the West Coast and all of the United States. It has been a major tourist destination since the 1960s, thanks to its wide array of attractions, the iconic Golden Gate Bridge fantastic views of the San Francisco Bay and brilliant summer weather.

San Diego Tourism Home to serene white-sand beaches, San Diego is popularly called 'America's Finest City'. San Diego is the second-largest city in California, while it ranks no. 8 in the list of the largest cities in the United States. With incredible weather conditions throughout the year and over 60 beaches, the sunny and warm San Diego is perfect to travel to throughout the year.

hotels.place: THE US GRANT, a Luxury Collection Hotel, San Diego

ChooseUs.title: Why Should You Choose Us
ChooseUs.subTitle: We have extensive knowledge and experience in the travel industry.

safety.safetyTitleInfo: Our top priority is the safety and well-being of our clients. We maintain high safety standards and have emergency support available during the trip. Our travel agency prioritizes your safety by partnering with trusted accommodations and transportation providers.

Whether it's a domestic tour or an international adventure, we cover a wide range of destinations to cater to different interests and proferences. Explore a diverse range of breathtaking destinations with our travel agency. Embark on unforgettable adventures with us.
Our dedicated customer support team is available round the clock to address any queries or concerns before during and after the trip. We ensuring a worry-free travel experience.

ClientReview.name: Devale
ClientReview.review: I recently went on a trip, and I must say it was an impressive experience. Their knowledgeable staff, hassle-free booking process, and well-curated itinerary exceeded my expectations.

ClientReview.name: Andi
ClientReview.review: Very easy to book and price promise was successful and altered invoice immediately.Very Efficient.

ClientReview.name: Stanzy
ClientReview.review: Very competitively priced, easy to use website and everything we were looking for.

ClientReview.name: Prince
ClientReview.review: Absolutely fantastic experience with thhis agency! Their attention to detail made our trip seamless and unforgettable. Highly recommended!!

ClientReview.name: Kito
ClientReview.review: The team went above and beyond to accommodate our preferences and create a tailor-made itinerary. A five-star service!

ClientReview.name: Manoj
ClientReview.review: I've traveled extensively, and this agency stands out for their exceptional customer service and expertise. They turned our trip into a dream vacation!

ClientReview.name: Srinivas
ClientReview.review: From start to finish, working with Trippy was a pleasure. Professional, knowledgeable and dedicated to making our trip perfect.

ClientReview.name: Vishwas
ClientReview.review: Impressive knowledge of destinations and a keen understanding of what travellers want. Thanks to them, our trip exceeded all expectations!!

ClientReview.name: Raju
ClientReview.review: Thier personalized approach and willingness to cater to our needs made our vacation unforgettable. We'll definitely be booking through them again!!

ClientReview.name: Veena
ClientReview.review: Kudos to the team for their prompt responses and meticulous planning. Our trip was seamless and we felt incredibly well taken care of.

ClientReview.name: Rajesh
ClientReview.review: A big thank you to Trippy for making our trip stress-free and memorable. Thier recommendations were spot on!

ClientReview.name: Ganesh
ClientReview.review: Highly impressed by the attention to detail and the effort put into ensuring everything went smoothly. I can't recommend them enough!

ClientReview.name: Vidya
ClientReview.review: Exceptional service from a team that truly cares about their clients. We had an amazing trip to Europe thanks to their expertize and dedication.

ClientReview.name: Mandy
ClientReview.review: While the overall experience was good, more communication before the trip would have been appreciated to clarify some details.

ClientReview.name: Hema
ClientReview.review: The itinerary was well planned, but having more options for off-beaten-path experiences could add value to your packages.

ClientReview.name: Priyanka
ClientReview.review: The booking process was smooth, but it would be great to have more user-friendly interface for selecting custom preferences online.

ClientReview.name: Anusha
ClientReview.review: The trip was enjoyable, yet providing a mobile app or online platform for easy access to travel documents and real-time updates would be convenient.

ClientReview.name: Charu
ClientReview.review: Though the customer service was good, having extended support hours or a dedicated emergency contact during travel could benhance peace of mind.

ClientReview.name: Manesh
ClientReview.review: While the overall package was great, offering more flexible payment plans or discounts for repeat customers could incentivize loyalty.

ClientReview.name: Laxmi
ClientReview.review: The guides were knowledgeable, but encouraging them to engage more with travelers and share personal insights about the destinations would be great.

Seeking a challenging position to utilize my skills in developing interactive, user-friendly websites.Committed to staying current and with modern web technologies and trends to deliver innovative solutions to meet client needs.

Desc: Working in Infosys PVTLTD, Bangalore as a UI developer since march 2020.

In my current Project working as a React Developer(UI developer) where we have built a completely user-friendly website by working with a team of 10 developers. And this website is completely Responsive as it can be access from Desktop/Tab/Mobile, with proper alignment of the design in which user is viewing.
This website is a Travel website where people can book there favorite destination and near by Hotels to there destination.
This Website is a User-Friendly and it's completely a Responsive website where User can access from Destop/Tab/Mobile, with proper alignment of the design in which user is viewing.

This website contain Dynamic Coding completely where the data is coming in the form of JSON format. If in case we have to add or delete data we can do it easily no need to alter the codes just change in JSON and everything will be done according.

In this website I have majorly taken care of DRC(Don't repeat code) process, Re-Useable components and code optimisation. So that we can reuse the common components and reduce the size of the website.
